website_summaries.verdict: Aside from a few quirks, this is an affordable chinois strainer that works as it should thanks to the ultra-fine mesh.
pros: Stainless steel strainer with very fine mesh that is effective at delivering notable results
Can hold an ample amount of food at a time
Price falls on the lower end of the spectrum
cons: Has quite a few crevices along the framework where particles can get stuck, making it challenging to clean

customer_reviews.title: A pretty awkward kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: A pretty awkward kitchen gadget. It feels imbalanced. The handle is hollow and cheaply made, and all the welded joints are very poorly done. This causes little particles of food to get trapped in all sorts of crevices unless you clean it *very* carefully. I've even cut myself on the edges when I wasn't being careful. Just filing them down would improve the product a decent bit. Overall, it is obvious that very little care and attention went into making this chinois.
customer_reviews.author: Lucchetti

customer_reviews.title: A VERY fine strainer!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent strainer for exacting applications, where one really wants ALL the sediment removed for a crystal-clear result! It's got 2 layers of a very fine stainless steel mesh, with a supporting structure that helps to discourage denting of the mesh. But- it is NOT easy to clean- especially by hand! Our dishwasher died and we have not yet replace it- and while I am confident this would clean beautifully in a dishwasher, it was pretty hard to clean by hand. Still- I am very happy with it, and plan to make some lovely clear stocks! Honestly, though- a one-layer very fine strainer would probably work fine, and is a lot easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: CissaTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Wanted one for Years
customer_reviews.text: I use this to strain homemade bone stock. It works beautifully and is easy to clean. I've used a normal strainer lined with cheesecloth for 25 years and I won't be going back to that now that I have this. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Coralline Algae

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for straining homemade Coconut Milk
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to strain my homemade coconut milk. Worked great! A little bit hard to clean, but I guess any fine mesh would be. I used a metal stand and a wooden pestle that came with another strainer I already had, milk turned out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Very fine mesh, but this sucker is huge
customer_reviews.text: I use this to strain my gravies and sauces, and I really like the super-fine mesh. When I use this I don't have to use cheesecloth. The only downside is, it's huge. It's a monster that seems to be made for an industrial kitchen. Maybe it is, at that. I like it, it's useful, it's just kind of too unwieldy in my small kitchen. Takes up a ton of space. If you have the cupboard space, though, this is a great strianer.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Good capacity, useful for both stock and yogurt
customer_reviews.text: I love the large size for straining both boullion/stock and yogurt. The only downside is that I don't have a tall container with a not-too-large and not-too-small opening to strain over, so the bottom often sits in the liquid and therefore doesn't strain as completely. For yogurt I needed to also use a cloth, but I still preferred it over a normal strainer due to the capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great chinoise.
customer_reviews.text: It is better than the ones I but from my supplier for the restaurant I work at. Solid quality and seems like it will last for years. But a bit of advice for these, if you are straining and using a ladle to push the medium through, be gentle and careful. That's the easiest way to destroy these quickly. It will stretch the screen and cause it to separate from the head.
customer_reviews.author: Todd C. Feitl

customer_reviews.title: I use for nut milk
customer_reviews.text: was about to stop making nut milks due to the bags, not sanitary enough for many reasons; ran across a video of someone using these so I thought I'd try; I can't attest to this being better than any other because it is my first; I did however pick this one because of someone reviewing saying they had tried others and this was the best and they too bought for milks; time will tell but I've made 3 batches, washed twice in dishwasher and all is going well
customer_reviews.author: c clark

customer_reviews.title: Stainless steel strainer.
customer_reviews.text: Love this strainer. I have used it multiple times. Love the fact that it is stainless steel. It will not rust. It is a fine strainer nothing goes through it except for the liquids. I used it when I made my own yogurt, soup. Works very well. Due to the design of this strainer, you need to have a long pot at home. If you don't have a long pot the strainer will tip over. It deserves a 5 stars but because of its design I thought I should give it a 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Lovetoshoponline

customer_reviews.title: ... Strainer has turned out to be one of my best purchases this year for the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: The Winco Reinforced Strainer has turned out to be one of my best purchases this year for the kitchen. It is definitely heavy duty and has a very fine mesh to give you thorough, cleaar straining without cheesecloth. I find I use it far more than I expected to because its performance as a tool has opened up more options in what/how I cook. This is a very good value in my mind.
customer_reviews.author: Cahlic McGregor

customer_reviews.title: Great for making greek yogurt
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to strain yogurt. Works like a charm. Only thing you should be aware of is that it is very deep. I used a large stock pot when I'm draining the whey out of the yogurt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good for Almond milk
customer_reviews.text: This might be good for a variety of uses but I wanted it to sieve almond milk after I mixed it in the blender. Most of the pieces of almond got through this one so it's not good for that.
customer_reviews.author: S. Friedland

customer_reviews.title: It's OK but it's hard to clean, hard to dry and takes up a lot of storage space
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new strainer and this was highly recommended. What's not to like? It does have a nice clip on the side opposite the handle. It works well. HOWEVER The strainer is large enough it's not easy to store. There are too many crevices and the handle is hollow. That makes it hard to clean and dry. It works well enough and I plan to keep it but with a bit more care in the design it could be SO much better.
customer_reviews.author: William Renfroe

customer_reviews.title: Prob should get the stand too
customer_reviews.text: This works great. Got it at first for almond milk making because im a lazy mf and dont want to squeeze it thru a bag but it wont like fit in any of my pots for me to just sit it there. Gotta get one of those stand things for it. It works ok, I would like it to strain a bit better even.
customer_reviews.author: Dirtywholefitness

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised at how big this thing is.
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly, but is as big as the pots in my cupboard. I expected it to be about the size of maybe a cup, but wow it's gigantic, which makes it difficult to clean. It extends past my sink and even into the side sink. It works as intended though.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Skeens

customer_reviews.title: Make Great Greek Yogurt and Stock
customer_reviews.text: Quality durable dishwasher safe product. Works very well for making Greek yogurt. Sits nicely in a Cambro 4-Quart Round container for straining yogurt or other foods.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if I got a bad one, but it's useless
customer_reviews.text: The fine mesh doesn't extend to the bottom essentially making the product useless for straining finer particles out
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Reagan

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is my first bouillon strainer so I don't have a frame of reference to compare how easy it is to clean. I have to work to get solids out of the bottom. other than that, it's the perfect tool for straining broths
customer_reviews.author: The Supply Guy

customer_reviews.title: wish I bought this years ago
customer_reviews.text: not only does it strain yogurt amazingly well but is it also super easy to clean. no more big mess. very solid product. Americas test kitchen gets it right again. highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Peter Zouboulakis

customer_reviews.title: It's OK.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet. I washed it in the dish washer when it arrived. I think I am seeing some brown under the ring that goes around the top of the basket that might be rust. It says it is stainless steel which doesn't rust. I don't know if that's all the utensil or just part of it. The basket has some indentations in it from rough handling that I would prefer were not there.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: I love it and worked great
customer_reviews.text: Used this after making chicken noodle soup. I love it and worked great. It is a lot larger than I expected and my husband had to help me since I couldn't pour in liquid and hold the strainer due to the size
customer_reviews.author: Maglio

customer_reviews.title: and getting good stainless steel at this price point is great
customer_reviews.text: If you cook, you need a chinois. This is exactly that. The build is solid, and getting good stainless steel at this price point is great. Now go forth and buy and henceforth thou shalt be known as SAUCE MASTER. SAUCE. <3
customer_reviews.author: SlugmanAD

customer_reviews.title: Been using for awhile. Works well, but the ...
customer_reviews.text: Been using for awhile. Works well, but the interior basket connection has an unusual rim that collect food debris and by product when straining. You have to be careful when cleaning and sanitizing.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: A very handy gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to make a wonderfully smooth raspberry puree and this worked like a charm. I am only giving it 4 stars because the cleaning of it is rather tedious. Otherwise, I would certainly buy this again if the situation called for it.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Used this to strain giblet gravy and dried elderberry syrup.

customer_reviews.title: Nice price

customer_reviews.title: Wish it were bigger and even finer mesh. It works fine for yogurt using a ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish it were bigger and even finer mesh. It works fine for yogurt using a half gallon milk but can't hold a full gallon which is what I usually make. Want a bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pulp!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. We use this to strain the pulp from our juicer.

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: I make tons of chicken stock at home, but hate to get particles of food in the stock, as it doesn't look good after canning. This gets everything out of the liquid! It's a fine mesh screen. I love this product - LOVE IT!

customer_reviews.title: The item arrived on time and is in good condition. I was hoping the mesh to be ...
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived on time and is in good condition. I was hoping the mesh to be finer than it actually is but workable for me to strain various kind of stock. I do need to find another strainer that can make bouillon more clear though.

customer_reviews.title: Can't compare it to the finer, more expensive model that people talk about
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Can't compare it to the finer, more expensive model that people talk about, but this makes a nice stock or sauce. There are a couple of sharp edges here and there, so be careful while cleaning it, but it is sturdy and well made.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, good price!

customer_reviews.text: We bought this item to stain our homemade yogurt and it works great. Easy to wash and keep clean.

customer_reviews.text: I love this strainer! I purchased it for making broth and it works great with super hot liquids and I love that it stands up on its own.

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. Just got it and the quality is questionable. The welds don't look great, the mesh is stretched out of shape in a couple of places, and the wire base is uneven and doesn't sit flat. Probably sending it back.

customer_reviews.title: Hand clean when wet and no problems.
customer_reviews.text: Strains to the appropriate level, no damage from regular use so far. Screen cleans easily enough if you spray it out quickly after use or after a good soak.

customer_reviews.title: Would love it to stand up on its own

If you make yogurt every day or work in a restaurant then you probably should get something more pro (like Matfer) but otherwise it is worth the money.

customer_reviews.title: This product is wonderful, as I no longer have to use cheese ...

customer_reviews.title: A little sharp on some corners of the handle like everyone says but nice solid construction and good stainless

customer_reviews.text: This is a very good strainer but it it is not super fine. It does however, do a good job.

customer_reviews.title: Nice fine screen does the trick

customer_reviews.text: Sure there are finer strainers out there but they don't compare with the value of this one. It could be welded in a few more spots for longevity but it hasn't given me an issue yet and strains everything I have needed it to so far.

customer_reviews.title: It was like my other one so I am very pleased

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, reasonably priced chinois

I had borrowed an expensive, very high quality French chinois from a chef I know, and I have to say that this one does as good or better of a job straining pureed raspberries. Seems to take less time and it's holding up fine, so I'm very happy with it.

customer_reviews.text: Works as promised and cleans up easily with a nylon brush.

customer_reviews.text: I mostly use this strainer when I make stocks. It is sturdy and reliable and it is a must for those who make there homemade stocks

customer_reviews.title: This is one heavy duty strainer and it is fine mesh. I have not measured the mesh size ...
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet used this but can attest to its quality of construction. This is one heavy duty strainer and it is fine mesh. I have not measured the mesh size but would say off hand that it is less than 1/32 inch. It will strain all but the tiniest shreds of your cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Used for Yogurt
customer_reviews.text: good quality strainer easy to clean I'm happy with this product and the price was good no complaints would buy it again

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular
customer_reviews.text: We are mainly using it to strain tea leaves when we make our earl grey ice cream. Does a spectacular job.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Hungerford

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous construction
customer_reviews.text: This chinois seems fine in terms of its primary function, i.e., straining. However, I am none too happy that the metal section right where it meets the mesh is razor sharp and sticking out enough to cut you pretty badly. I was just moving it over in a dish area while it was flipped upside down (cone point up) and my thumb ran against this metal and was gashed open. So 5 stars for chinois at this price, 1 star for hazard = 3 stars??
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Its a very good item, but larger than I though. I might order a smaller one in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Joan I Olson

customer_reviews.title: Thai Tea
customer_reviews.text: Wow making Thai tea is so much easier with this little device. No need for extra hands and you can also line it with cheese cloth for better straining.
customer_reviews.author: R. Little

customer_reviews.title: Good strainer, possibly weak welds
customer_reviews.text: This strainer has fine enough mesh for cheese making and does the job. The welds appear to be somewhat poorly constructed but the strainer is functional.
customer_reviews.author: BusyWorkingMom2x

customer_reviews.title: works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I make a lot of homemade stock and regular strainers just weren't big enough. This is large enough and is very sturdy. Absolutely recommend if you strain large batches of anything.
customer_reviews.author: Duk Dawg

customer_reviews.title: impractical without a prop
customer_reviews.text: It works ok but I should have realized, looking at this design, that it would fall right over since there's nothing to support the handle. Very awkward to try to prop up the handle on random stuff to steady it when I'm using both hands to pour a heavy pot of broth through it. I wouldn't get this model again, or any model that didn't come with some sort of prop.
customer_reviews.author: Just Another Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Too fine of a mesh means no velvety soups - just broths will get through
customer_reviews.text: The holes are actually SO small that a creamy soup ends up becoming VERY watery. I was trying to make a salmorejo (like a spanish gaspacho) but I wanted to get rid of any seeds or skin. Instead I ended up loosing all of the flavor and a lot more than seeds and skin. I guess if you're making a clear broth this works, but it didn't do what I was hoping for in creating a smooth velvety texture.
customer_reviews.author: J. Alderson

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to strain yogurt. 95% passed right through. Sent back.
customer_reviews.author: MGK

customer_reviews.title: poor spot welds, but holdi
customer_reviews.text: working good, but the spot welds are small and seem weak, hope they hold for the long term, I didn't like the plastic topped ones because of heat issues, but they hold the mesh nice n strong.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan S

customer_reviews.title: wonderful strainer
customer_reviews.text: I've seen these on cooking shows and wanted one of these for years. I've looked in retail stores and they were always far to expensive. I saw this online and couldn't pass it up. It really does make the most smooth soups and sauces. I use it to make my red chili and mole sauces. It's so much easier than the round strainers.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Bobbitt

customer_reviews.title: There was some rust in the crevices when I opened ...
customer_reviews.text: There was some rust in the crevices when I opened the product. Cleaned it up and it is highly functional.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: This is one handy gadget. It really makes the work easier. Its an easy cleanup also. Recommend for all who like to cook like my husband.
customer_reviews.author: Janice McKinley

customer_reviews.title: Stock-making in large batches
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet, but looks well-made and think I'll be happy. It is deep, so, as other reviews have noted, you need to have a deep receptacle. I want to make big batches of stock, as it is an undertaking, so this is just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Forth!

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit my needs
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a yogurt strainer. When we received it, we could tell that the holes were too big for our needs. We have a much smaller strainer with a finer mesh and that didn't work. We wound up not trying it at all. The description does not state "yogurt strainer" and it may work just fine for it's intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff C

customer_reviews.title: Fine for straining, but not for yogurt
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews indicating this strainer worked for straining homemade yogurt, I had high hopes as that was my main intended use. However, I could tell the hole sizes were inconsistent around the strainer. It is double-wall mesh, but in some areas it looked stretched or that the way the mesh overlapped didn't make for smaller hole size. As suspected my yogurt went straight through. It's still great for staining broth.
customer_reviews.author: Jem

customer_reviews.title: Finest China Cap Yet !
customer_reviews.text: I seem to have bought all the large China Caps because there are no real large Chinos on line. This one is the finest of the mall if that helps you. Again, I use a gallon plastic pitcher as the collector, it fits perfectly into one. And yes, I needed the beech wood pestle for sure. See other purchase - works like a charm.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
